VII.i.3.C.2.c
.
Determining Whether a Child’s Marriage Is Void
Follow the steps in the table below to determine whether a child’s marriage is void.
Step
Action
1
Fully develop the facts surrounding the alleged void marriage.  This includes obtaining statements from parties to the “marriage.”
2
Submit the case to District Counsel for a legal opinion as to whether or not the marriage is void.
Reference
:  For more information on when to obtain an opinion from District Counsel, see
M21-1, Part VII, Subpart i, 1.A.3.d
.
3
Did District Counsel declare the marriage void?
If
yes,
determine the effective date of an award or an increased award per the information in
M21-1, Part VII, Subpart i, 3.C.2.e
.
If
no
, deny the claim.
Note
:  No administrative decision is required.
Reference
:  For more information on determining whether a marriage is void, see
M21-1, Part VII, Subpart i, 2.A.6
.
